text.0: i laud with newest songs the righteous people mitra and varuṇa who make us happy.
text.1: let them approach here let them listenagni varuṇa mitra lords of fair dominion.
text.2: him to be praised at each tribes sacrifices the two young matrons soberminded herald.
text.3: the son of strength the child of heaven the signal of sacrifice red agni will i worship.
text.4: unlike in form are the red gods two daughters one is the suns and stars bedeck the other.
text.5: apart the sanctifiers in succession come to the famed hymn praised in holy verses.
text.6: i with a lofty song call hither vāyu allbounteous filler of his car most wealthy.
text.7: thou sage with bright path lord of harnessed horses impetuous promptly honourest the prudent.
text.8: that chariot of the aśvins fair to look on pleaseth me well yoked with a thought refulgent.
text.9: wherewith nāsatyas chiefs ye seek our dwelling to give new strength to us and to our children.
text.10: bulls of the earth o vāta and parjanya stir up for us the regions of the water.
text.11: hearers of truth ye sages worldsupporters increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.
text.12: so may sarasvatī the heros consort brisk with rare life the lightnings child inspire us.
text.13: and with the dames accordant give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.
text.14: i praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways he when his love impelled him went to arka.
text.15: may he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it may pūṣan make each prayer of ours efective.
text.16: may herald agni fulgent bring for worship tvaṣṭar adored in homes and swift to listen.
text.17: glorious first to share the lifebestower the ever active god fairarmed fairhanded.
text.18: rudra by day rudra at night we honour with these our songs the universes father.
text.19: him great and lofty blissful undecaying let us call specially as the sage impels us.
text.20: ye who are youthful wise and meet for worship come martits to the longing of the singer.
text.21: coming as erst to aṅgiras o heroes ye animate and quicken een the desert.
text.22: even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle i urge my songs to him the strong swift hero.
text.23: may he the glorious lay upon his body the singers hymns as stars bedeck the heaven.
text.24: he who for mans behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions viṣṇu.
text.25: when one so great as thou affordeth shelter may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.
text.26: sweet be this song of mine to ahibudhnya parvata savitar with floods and lightnings.
text.27: sweet with the plants to gods who seek oblations may liberal bhaga speed us on to riches.
text.28: give riches borne on cars with many heroes contenting men the guard of mighty order.
text.29: give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us and meet with tribes to whom the gods are gracious.
